mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Manual to the palms of Ecuador

mods:originInfo.mods:publisher: AAU Reports 37. Department of Systematic Botany, University of Aarhus, Denmark in collaboration with Pontificia Universidad Catï¿½lica del Ecuador

nomenclature.name: Ceroxylon vogelianum
nomenclature.author: (Engel) H.Wendl. in O.C.E.de Kerchove de Denterghem

div.p: Understorey or subcanopy palm. Stem solitary, to 10 m tall, ca. 10 cm in diameter, greenish grey, with dark leaf scars. Leaves 1-1.5 m long; pinnae 70-80 on each side, inserted in groups and spreading in different planes, with pendulous distal half, the central ones 30-40 cm long, 20-25 mm wide, below with a thin, light grey to brown wax layer. Inflorescences curved, becoming pendulous in fruit, 120-160 cm long, branched 2 times. Male flowers with 6 stamens. Fruits globose, bluish green, often becoming dull orange just before dropping, slightly warty, 13-15 mm in diameter.
Venezuela to Bolivia in the Andes.
Plants from S Ecuador, where the species is common, are relatively small compared to what is usual for the species
